summary: Dr. Vitalis O. Ojiegbbe's medical license was summarily suspended due to allegations of inappropriately prescribing high dosages of opioids to cash-paying patients, many with histories of substance abuse, often exceeding recommended daily limits. He was also found to have engaged in unprofessional conduct, failed to maintain adequate records, had unsecured patient records, and misrepresented his board certification status. The Maryland State Board of Physicians concluded that public health and safety required emergency action.
